name: Mercy USA for Aid and Development
mission: Mercy-USA for Aid and Development is dedicated to alleviating human suffering and supporting individuals and their communities in their efforts to become more self-sufficient. Our philosophy is "Helping People Help Themselves".  Incorporated in the State of Michigan in 1988, Mercy-USA's projects focus on improving health, nutrition and access to safe water, as well as promoting economic and educational growth and providing disaster relief around the world.

rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1988</cite>, Mercy-USA for Aid and Development is a global humanitarian organization that provides life-saving nutrition, health services, and sustainable development to vulnerable populations. The organization operates at significant scale, reporting <cite id="2">$54,067,823 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year. Their primary focus remains on <cite id="3">health and nutrition for children and mothers</cite> in high-need regions such as Somalia, Syria, and Gaza. Mercy-USA is distinguished by its operational efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 96.3%</cite> while achieving an <cite id="5">overall score of 92.33333333333333/100</cite> from Charity Navigator. Beyond emergency relief, the charity invests in long-term infrastructure, such as <cite id="6">cistern rehabilitation serving 10,000 people</cite> and the construction of <cite id="7">950 modular homes</cite> for displaced families. For Muslim donors, the organization provides a <cite id="8">verified zakat-eligible platform</cite> that directs funds to specific asnaf categories including the poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin). Their work in Somalia is particularly notable, where they maintain a <cite id="9">TB cure rate of 80%</cite> through dedicated health centers. Despite a <cite id="10">3-year revenue CAGR of -8.6%</cite>, the organization continues to reach millions across <cite id="11">Gaza, Yemen, Bangladesh, and Lebanon</cite>.
